channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Korean food gets a Michelin-starred makeover in Seoul restaurants
item.description: South Korea's restaurants are fine-tuning traditional dishes and adding the taste of culinary success to the trophy chest of Korean cultural power.
item.content:encoded: South Korea's restaurants are fine-tuning traditional dishes and adding the taste of culinary success to the trophy chest of Korean cultural power.
item.dc:creator: Anthony Kuhn

item.title: It's easy to tune out politics. Biden's campaign is using an app to get around that
item.description: Biden volunteers will still knock on doors and try to get voters on the phone. But they're also using an app to connect with hard-to reach voters this year.
item.content:encoded:
Biden volunteers will still knock on doors and try to get voters on the phone. But they're also using an app to connect with hard-to reach voters this year.

(Image credit: Maayan Silver)
item.dc:creator: Tamara Keith

item.title: What is ISIS-K, the group that claims it carried out the Moscow concert attack?
item.description: ISIS-K is one of the most militant jihadist groups in the world, often mounting attacks against other Islamist groups, while also targeting Russia and the U.S.
item.content:encoded:
ISIS-K is one of the most militant jihadist groups in the world, often mounting attacks against other Islamist groups, while also targeting Russia and the U.S.

(Image credit: Vahid Salemi)
item.dc:creator: Brian Mann

item.title: Nearly 300 abducted Nigerian schoolchildren freed after over two weeks in captivity
item.description: Nearly 300 kidnapped Nigerian schoolchildren have been released, more than two weeks after the children were seized from their school in the northwestern state of Kaduna and marched into the forests.
item.content:encoded:
Nearly 300 kidnapped Nigerian schoolchildren have been released, more than two weeks after the children were seized from their school in the northwestern state of Kaduna and marched into the forests.

(Image credit: Sunday Alamba)

item.title: Death toll from Moscow concert hall attack rises to 133 as Putin addresses the nation
item.description: The Russian president described the violent shooting as "a bloody, barbaric terrorist act" after a group linked to the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the event.
item.content:encoded:
The Russian president described the violent shooting as "a bloody, barbaric terrorist act" after a group linked to the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the event.

(Image credit: Olga Maltseva)
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Rosman

item.title: Princess Kate's cancer triggers public shock, sympathy â€” and shame on the tabloids
item.description: "It has been an incredibly tough couple of months for our entire family," the Princess of Wales said in a video filmed in secret and released Friday.
item.content:encoded:
"It has been an incredibly tough couple of months for our entire family," the Princess of Wales said in a video filmed in secret and released Friday.

(Image credit: Leon Neal)
item.dc:creator: Lauren Frayer

item.title: So your NCAA bracket is busted. Should you have just chosen all the top seeds?
item.description: As the dust settles from the early rounds of the NCAA Tournament, we bid farewell to the would-be Cinderellas who couldn't pull off the upset and take stock of your tattered bracket.
item.content:encoded:
As the dust settles from the early rounds of the NCAA Tournament, we bid farewell to the would-be Cinderellas who couldn't pull off the upset and take stock of your tattered bracket.

(Image credit: Jamie Squire)
item.dc:creator: Becky Sullivan

item.title: Like a Phish concert but with more grievance, this is what it's like at a Trump rally
item.description: Many Americans won't experience a rally for former President Donald Trump in person, instead witnessing these events through viral clips. But for the faithful, a Trump rally is so much more than that.
item.content:encoded:
Many Americans won't experience a rally for former President Donald Trump in person, instead witnessing these events through viral clips. But for the faithful, a Trump rally is so much more than that.

(Image credit: Elijah Nouvelage)
item.dc:creator: Danielle Kurtzleben

item.title: My patients think Ozempic is a wonder drug. But it can't fix fat phobia
item.description: Yes, as Oprah enthused, the drugs help people shrink their bodies. But the psychological damage of weight stigma can't be so easily cured, a doctor writes.
item.content:encoded: Yes, as Oprah enthused, the drugs help people shrink their bodies. But the psychological damage of weight stigma can't be so easily cured, a doctor writes.
item.dc:creator: Mara Gordon

item.title: Israeli settlers step up attacks on Palestinian farms, expanding West Bank outposts
item.description: NPR visits one West Bank town where Israelis are grazing sheep, in a place where a Palestinian school once stood.
item.content:encoded: NPR visits one West Bank town where Israelis are grazing sheep, in a place where a Palestinian school once stood.
item.dc:creator: Eleanor Beardsley
